message.content: {"id": "18934", "title": "Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example", "description": "", "OB": "When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2/KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled and movable, but they do not have any effect.", "EB": "Scrollbars should be disabled in the ImageAnalyzer example.", "SR": "Disable the scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example to prevent confusion for users when interacting with small images that do not require scrolling."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '18934', 'title': 'Bug 18934Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only)Open the ImageAnalyzer example.Notice the scrollbars are enabled, and you can move them around, but they don'thave any effect. If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars arejust misleading because they don't do anything. "}
